thread.title: J.P. Morgan to consider adopting proxy access
thread.title_full: J.P. Morgan to consider adopting proxy access - MarketWatch

author: Lauren Pollock
title: J.P. Morgan to consider adopting proxy access
text:
J.P. Morgan Chase & Co. said Monday that it will consider giving certain big investors the chance to nominate members to its board, potentially joining a long list of U.S. companies opening up corporate elections this year.
The change to the bank’s JPM, +0.05% bylaws, which will be considered at the next regularly scheduled board meeting, would give shareholders the right to place their director nominees in the firm’s proxy statement. Specifically, the amendment would allow investors to nominate up to 20% of the board, or least two directors, and include a shareholder ownership threshold requirement of 3% for at least three consecutive years.
Citigroup Inc. adopted a similar plan earlier this year with identical ownership thresholds. Among other companies that have taken the step are General Electric Co., Chevron Co. and Coca-Cola Co.
An expanded version of this report appears at WSJ.com .
